intro: Galium pamiroalaicum, commonly known as the Pamir bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or grassy areas at high elevations. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium pamiroalaicum is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and adaptation to harsh mountain environments.
